weekly_desc:
This week felt like a bit of a blur, honestly. It's weird, because I'm getting a decent amount of sleep and my energy levels feel good, but there's this underlying hum of anxiety that just won't quit. I think it's mostly about classes.

Academically, it was a mixed bag. COSC 065, for the most part, I actually enjoyed. We had a couple of assignments, and while they were challenging, I felt like I was really getting something out of them. There was another assignment for that class too, which was a bit more neutral for me, but overall, I'm still feeling pretty good about it. COSC 070, though... that one's been a bit tougher. We had two assignments there this week, and I just felt pretty neutral about the whole experience. It's not that I dislike the material, but it just hasn't clicked as much.

The biggest challenge, and something I'm really beating myself up about, is my class attendance. Looking back, I realized I missed quite a few lectures this week. I know it's not ideal, and it definitely adds to that anxious feeling. I was around campus a lot – spent a ton of time in Baker-Berry Library, and even some late nights in Sudikoff Hall trying to catch up on the CS assignments. It feels like I'm always *doing* something, always trying to stay on top of things, but then I look at my schedule and see those missed classes and it just makes me worry. It's like I'm trying to learn everything on my own, which is fine for some things, but I know I'm missing out on the in-person explanations and discussions.

Socially, things were pretty quiet. I had that one outing to West Lebanon, which was a nice change of scenery, but mostly it was just me and my textbooks. My social battery is pretty neutral right now, which is fine, but sometimes I wonder if I should be making more of an effort.

The upcoming week looks pretty intense with all those deadlines piling up, especially on Monday and Tuesday. It's a lot to juggle, and I'm already feeling the pressure to make sure I don't fall further behind.

So, for next week, my main goals are pretty clear:
1.  **Prioritize class attendance.** No more missing lectures. I need to be there, engaged, and absorbing the material in real-time.
2.  **Tackle those deadlines head-on.** I need to map out exactly what's due when and start chipping away at it now, not the night before.
3.  **Re-engage with the material.** Especially for COSC 070, I want to try and find a way to make it more interesting and less of a chore. Maybe office hours, or finding a study group.
4.  **Maintain my energy.** Even with the stress, I've been sleeping well, and I want to keep that up so I can actually focus when I need to.

It's going to be a busy one, but I'm determined to turn things around and feel more in control.
judge_reasoning:
```

weekly_desc:
Okay, another week down. It feels like a blur, honestly. My happiness is definitely not where I want it to be, which is a bit frustrating, especially since I've actually been getting a decent amount of sleep and my stamina feels pretty good. It's like my body is fine, but my brain is just… tired.

Classes this week were a mixed bag, to put it mildly. COSC 065 had a couple of assignments or quizzes, and my feelings about it are all over the place. Some days I felt like I was really getting it and even enjoying it, but then other times, it just felt like a slog. I even disagreed enjoying it at one point, which is a tough feeling to have about a class you're in. And I know I missed a few of the 065 lectures – Thursday, Friday, and Monday. That's not ideal, and it's definitely making me feel a bit behind, especially since my knowledge in that area feels a bit shaky.

COSC 070 wasn't much better on the attendance front. I missed both the Thursday and Tuesday sessions. I don't know, it's just been hard to get myself there sometimes. I feel a bit guilty about it, knowing how important it is to keep up, but it just felt like there were so many other things pulling at my attention, or maybe I just wasn't feeling up to it. I did spend a late night in Sudikoff on Wednesday, which was probably me trying to catch up on something COSC-related, so at least I'm trying to put in the work when I can.

I've been spending a lot of time around the library and the Admissions Office area, which usually means I'm either trying to study or just navigating campus. It's a bit weird, though, because I also found myself off campus a couple of times – out in Sutton and Lebanon on Thursday, and then again in West Lebanon on Sunday. I guess those were attempts to get a change of scenery or just clear my head, but they weren't exactly social outings. My social battery feels pretty low right now, and I haven't really connected with anyone much this week. It's something I notice, but it's hard to push myself when I'm already feeling a bit overwhelmed.

The biggest challenge right now is definitely the sheer number of deadlines looming. I have three things due Monday night, two more on Tuesday, and another on Wednesday. It's a lot to juggle, especially with feeling like I'm already playing catch-up in some of my classes. The thought of it is honestly making me pretty anxious.

For next week, my main goal has to be getting a handle on these assignments. I need to prioritize and really focus on getting them done, and done well. I also really need to try and make it to all my classes. Missing them just adds to the stress and the feeling of being behind. Maybe I can also try to reach out to someone, even just for a quick chat, to boost that social score a little. It's a lot to ask, but I know I'll feel better if I can tackle these things head-on.
judge_reasoning:
```

weekly_desc:
This week felt like a bit of a blur, honestly. I'm trying to piece it all together, but there's this underlying hum of anxiety that makes everything feel a little… off. My happiness levels are definitely not where I want them to be, and I can feel that familiar tightness in my chest when I think about everything on my plate.

Academically, COSC 065 is proving to be quite the beast. We had an assignment or quiz every single class this week, which is a lot to keep up with. I generally enjoy the class, the material is interesting, but the constant deadlines are a real pressure cooker. It's like I'm always just barely keeping my head above water. COSC 070 also had its usual schedule, and while I was there, I feel like I'm still trying to fully grasp some of the concepts. It's weird, I know I have a good grasp on things overall, but then there are these specific areas where I just feel like I'm missing something fundamental, like my knowledge is suddenly at 30 instead of 95. It's a frustrating feeling.

I spent a lot of time in Sudikoff, especially late at night, trying to get ahead or just catch up. It feels like my second home sometimes. I also found myself gravitating towards the library and McNutt Hall, even when I wasn't actively studying, just being in that academic environment.

Mid-week, I ended up at Dick's House. Nothing major, just felt like I needed to check in, you know? With everything going on, sometimes it just feels like a lot, and I wanted to make sure I was okay. It's a bit embarrassing to admit, but it helped to just talk to someone. Later in the week, I found myself at that little chapel in Otterville. It was a strange detour, but I just needed a moment of quiet, away from everything. It was surprisingly peaceful.

Socially, I've been pretty isolated. My social meter is definitely in the red. I haven't really connected with anyone beyond quick hellos in class. It's not ideal, but when I'm feeling this overwhelmed with academics, it's hard to prioritize anything else. I did make it to the gym a couple of times, which was good. It's a solid way to burn off some of that nervous energy, and at least my stamina and sleep are holding up, which is a small victory.

Looking ahead, the sheer number of deadlines next week is daunting. Three things due Monday, two on Tuesday, and another on Wednesday. It feels like a never-ending cycle. My main goal is to tackle those COSC 065 assignments head-on and try to get a better handle on the COSC 070 material that's been tripping me up. I also really need to make an effort to connect with people, even if it's just grabbing coffee with a friend. I know it would help my mood. And I need to remember to take those small breaks, like the gym, to keep myself from completely burning out. This week was tough, but I'm determined to make next week a little less stressful, or at least manage the stress better.

weekly_desc:
This week felt… heavy. My happiness is definitely at a low point, and honestly, I can feel that familiar knot of anxiety tightening in my stomach. It’s hard to shake off, especially when I look back at how things went.

Classes were a mess, to be blunt. I don't know what happened, but I just couldn't bring myself to go to any of them. Not COSC 070, not COSC 065. I know, I know, it’s completely unlike me, and the guilt is really eating at me. I kept telling myself I’d catch up, or that I’d just work from the library, but then the time would come, and I’d just… stay put. It’s frustrating because I *want* to be on top of things, and I know how important attendance is, especially with all the material we're covering.

COSC 065, in particular, has been a real struggle. We had an assignment this week, and my feelings about the class are all over the place – some days I feel like I get it, others I just completely disagree with how things are going or feel totally lost. It’s probably why my knowledge score for that specific area feels so low, even though I generally feel like I grasp concepts pretty well. With all those deadlines looming for Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, I really need to get a handle on it. The thought of all that work piling up is pretty overwhelming.

Socially, it was a quiet week. Too quiet, probably. My social meter is practically on empty. I’m not the most extraverted person, but even for me, this felt isolating. I spent a lot of time in the library or just around campus, but not really interacting with anyone. It’s a bit lonely, and I do miss just having casual conversations or grabbing a meal with someone. I did manage to get to the gym a couple of times, which was good for my stamina, and I even made it to the Hopkins Center for the Arts on Sunday evening, which was a nice change of pace and a good way to clear my head for a bit. But mostly, it felt like I was just existing in my own little bubble.

The biggest challenge, without a doubt, was my inability to attend classes. It’s a cycle – I feel overwhelmed, so I avoid, and then avoiding makes me feel more overwhelmed and guilty. My conscientiousness is screaming at me for this, and my neurotic side is just amplifying all the worry. I also need to figure out why I’m feeling so disconnected socially.

For next week, my goals are pretty clear, even if they feel daunting:
1.  **Get back to class.** No excuses. I need to be physically present and engaged. I'll set extra alarms and make a point of leaving for class well in advance.
2.  **Tackle COSC 065 head-on.** I need to review the material I missed and really focus on understanding the concepts that are tripping me up. I'll try to find some extra resources or even reach out to the TA if I'm still stuck.
3.  **Manage those deadlines.** I'll break down each assignment into smaller, manageable chunks and schedule dedicated time for them. No more last-minute rushes.
4.  **Make an effort to connect.** Even if it’s just a quick chat with someone in the library or a study group, I need to push myself to have some social interaction. My happiness really depends on it.

I know I can turn this around. It just feels like a lot right now.

weekly_desc:
This week felt like a blur, honestly. My head's still spinning a bit, and looking back, it's clear I haven't been on top of things as much as I usually like to be. My happiness feels pretty low, and I can definitely feel that underlying hum of anxiety that just won't quit.

Academically, COSC 065 was a real struggle. We had so many assignments and quizzes this week, and I just couldn't get into it. I mean, "strongly disagreed enjoying" and "disagreed enjoying" pretty much sums it up. It felt like I was constantly playing catch-up, and the material just wasn't clicking. It's frustrating because I usually enjoy problem-solving, but this week it just felt like a chore.

And that's probably why I ended up missing so many of my actual classes. I know, I know, it's not ideal, and it makes me feel really guilty. My schedule says I should have been in Sudikoff for COSC 070 or LSB for COSC 065, but I just… wasn't there. I think I was either trying to cram for the next thing, or just completely overwhelmed and couldn't bring myself to go. It's a bad habit I need to break, especially with all these deadlines looming.

Speaking of cramming, my "activity" logs show I was practically living in Sudikoff and Baker-Berry Library late at night. Wednesday night, Saturday night, even Sunday morning – I was in Sudikoff or the library, just trying to get work done. I even ended up in Fairchild super early Wednesday morning. It feels like I'm doing all my work when everyone else is asleep, which probably explains why my sleep score is so low. My stamina isn't great either, which makes sense when you're pulling those kinds of hours. I did manage to get to the gym once, which was a small win, but it wasn't enough to really recharge.

My social life? What social life? My social score is practically non-existent, and the data confirms it. I barely saw anyone outside of my own head this week. I did pop into The Works Café for a bit, but that was more about getting a change of scenery than actual interaction. It's not like I don't *want* to be social, but when the workload feels this heavy, it's the first thing that gets cut. And then I feel even more isolated, which just adds to the stress.

The upcoming deadlines are definitely weighing on me – three things due Monday, two on Tuesday, and another on Wednesday. It's a lot to juggle, especially when I feel like I'm already behind.

Challenges this week were definitely managing my time, staying on top of class attendance, and just generally keeping my head above water with the workload. The constant feeling of being overwhelmed and the lack of enjoyment in COSC 065 really got to me.

For next week, I really need to turn things around. My goals are:
1.  **Prioritize class attendance:** No more skipping. I need to be in those lectures, even if I feel behind. It's the only way to truly catch up.
2.  **Better time management:** I need to start assignments earlier and break them down so I'm not pulling all-nighters. My sleep needs to improve, or I'm just going to burn out.
3.  **Address COSC 065 head-on:** I need to figure out what's making it so difficult. Maybe office hours, or finding a study group. I can't keep feeling this way about it.
4.  **Force some social interaction:** Even if it's just grabbing coffee with someone for 30 minutes. I know it helps my mood, and I need to make time for it.
5.  **Focus on well-being:** Get more sleep, eat better, and try to fit in more physical activity. My body and mind are clearly telling me they need a break.

It's going to be tough, but I'm determined to make next week better. I can't keep going like this.

This week felt like a blur, honestly. I'm just so tired, all the time. My head feels foggy, and it's hard to focus on anything for long. I know I'm not getting enough sleep, and it's really starting to catch up with me.

Classes... that's a tough one to write about. I feel a knot in my stomach just thinking about it. I didn't make it to any of my COSC 070 or COSC 065 lectures this week. I was *around* campus, sometimes even near the buildings, but I just couldn't bring myself to go in. It's like there's this invisible wall. I know how important attendance is, especially with all these deadlines looming, and the thought of falling behind just makes the anxiety worse. It's a vicious cycle. I'm usually so on top of things, and this feels really unlike me.

Most of my "activity" this week seemed to be late at night. I spent a lot of time in Sudikoff, trying to get a handle on the COSC assignments. And the library, too. I feel like I'm constantly playing catch-up, or trying to get ahead, but it just means I'm sacrificing sleep. I was at the Hopkins Center really late a couple of times too – I guess I needed a break, or just a change of scenery, even if it was just wandering around.

And the Admissions Office... I feel like I've practically moved in there this week. There's just been so much administrative stuff to sort out, and it's incredibly draining. Every time I think I've got it handled, something else pops up. It's a constant source of low-level stress that just chips away at my energy. I even ended up at Dick's House on Friday, just feeling completely run down. I did manage to get to the gym once, which was good, but it felt like a monumental effort.

Socially, I'm pretty sure my score is at an all-time low. I haven't really connected with anyone this week. It's not that I don't want to, but when I'm this exhausted and stressed, the thought of trying to engage with people just feels overwhelming. I just want to crawl into bed and sleep for a week.

The biggest challenge, obviously, is the missed classes and the sheer exhaustion. It's hard to be productive when you're running on fumes. And with all these deadlines for Monday and Tuesday, I'm feeling the pressure intensely. I know I have the knowledge, but getting it all done feels impossible right now.

For next week, my absolute top priority has to be getting to class. No matter what. I need to break this cycle of avoidance. I also need to figure out a way to get more sleep, even if it means cutting back on something else. Maybe I can try to tackle the administrative stuff earlier in the day so it doesn't eat into my evenings. And if I can, just one or two intentional social interactions, even if it's just a quick chat with someone. I know I need to take better care of myself, but it feels so hard when there's so much to do. I just hope I can turn things around.

weekly_desc:
This week felt like a bit of a whirlwind, honestly. On the surface, I'm doing pretty well – I'm getting enough sleep, feeling good, and I've even managed to keep up with friends, which is always a win. My social battery feels surprisingly full, and I've got a good amount of energy. But underneath all that, there's this persistent hum of anxiety, especially with all the deadlines piling up. It's like I'm constantly aware of everything I *should* be doing.

Academically, it's been a mixed bag. COSC 065 had that one assignment, and I felt pretty neutral about it. It wasn't bad, but it didn't exactly spark joy either. I've been trying to keep up with the material, but I have to admit, I found myself making some tough choices this week. With so many deadlines looming – seriously, a bunch due Monday and Tuesday, and then another on Wednesday – I ended up prioritizing deep work on assignments over attending every single lecture. I know it's not ideal, and my conscientiousness definitely makes me feel a bit guilty about it, but sometimes it feels like the only way to stay on top of things. I was definitely burning the midnight oil in Sudikoff on Wednesday night, trying to get ahead on some COSC stuff. And I spent a good chunk of time in the Baker-Berry Library too, which always feels productive.

It's a weird balance. My knowledge levels feel high, and I'm learning a lot, but the pressure to perform and deliver on all these assignments is real. It makes me question if I'm doing things the "right" way by sometimes skipping lectures to focus on problem sets.

Socially, I did manage to get out a bit, which was nice. I caught something at the Hopkins Center on Sunday night – it's always good to step away from the books and experience something different. And Tuesday, I grabbed dinner at Jewel of India, which was a nice break. Those moments really help recharge me, even if I'm not the most extraverted person out there. I think it's important to make time for those connections.

Looking ahead to next week, my main goal is to find a better rhythm. I really want to try and make it to all my COSC 065 and COSC 070 classes. I know the material is important, and even if I'm learning it independently, being in class helps solidify things and keeps me accountable. I also need to stay super organized with these upcoming deadlines. It feels like a constant battle against the clock, but I'm determined to tackle everything head-on. And, as always, I need to remind myself to breathe and not let the stress completely take over, even when that little voice in my head is screaming about everything that needs to be done.

weekly_desc:
This week felt… a bit of a mixed bag, honestly. On one hand, my sleep has been pretty solid, which is a huge plus, and I've felt really connected with my friends. My social battery feels fully charged, which always boosts my spirits, and my stamina has been good too. It's nice to feel well-rested and supported.

Academically, though, it's a different story. It's weird to see "no class experience recorded" because, well, I *was* supposed to have COSC 065 on Wednesday morning. But I… didn't make it. I ended up at Baker-Berry for a bit around that time, trying to get a head start on some readings, but then just felt a bit overwhelmed and couldn't quite focus. It wasn't a productive "activity" in the way I'd hoped, and I ended up just kind of drifting. Missing class always makes me feel a bit off-kilter, like I'm already playing catch-up, and that feeling has been nagging at me.

Later in the day, I did make it to Tuck and then LSB, but again, not for any scheduled classes. Just some general campus wandering and maybe a quick study session that didn't quite materialize into anything concrete. It's interesting how much time I spend just *being* on campus, even when not in a scheduled class.

The biggest cloud hanging over me right now are these deadlines. Seeing so many of them clustered around Monday and Tuesday, with another on Wednesday, is a bit daunting, honestly. I feel this pressure to get everything perfect, and the thought of falling behind just makes my stomach clench. My knowledge levels are high, which is good, but applying it under pressure is a different beast.

For next week, my absolute top priority is getting back on track with classes. No more missed lectures, especially with COSC 065 and 070. I need to be disciplined about attending every single one. And then, tackling these deadlines head-on. I need to break them down into smaller, manageable chunks so I don't get overwhelmed. Maybe I'll try to find a new study spot, or just be more intentional about my time in the library. And definitely reach out to a classmate if I feel stuck. It wasn't my most productive week academically, but I'm feeling good about my overall well-being and ready to reset. Just need to channel that energy into my studies now.
